fields.summary: upgrade to latest spring (at least 2.5.4)

fields.description:
Originated from http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257280128#257280128

The idea is to provide a way of saying which directories or repositories create a project. Then additional views should be available - like list of projects user is associated with (instead/additionally of repositories on the main page).
Also notifications, changelog, and other subviews should be project based.
fields.summary: Abstraction layer for projects - differentiate projects from repositories

fields.description:
Hello,

Can demo.cenqua.com please be upgraded to the latest version.

Thanks,
Nick
fields.summary: Upgrade demo.cenqua.com to FE/CRU 1.5

fields.description:
I have had several users (and myself) notice that the directory widget in the lower left corner is much slower than it was in the 1.4 version of FishEye. I am also having users complain about broad searches which time out (300+ seconds) the reverse proxy to Apache without returning anything.

Just by hand timing I find that a couple of our top level directories take about 12-15 seconds or more before returning their children contents (which is only about 5-10 items).  When you have to go down 4+ directories to get to a project trunk this is very annoying.

It appears that only directories which either contain a lot of items, or which have a child/grandchild/etc somewhere under it which has a lot of items, are slow to load, even if the parent only has a few direct children.
fields.summary: Directory widget and search are now much slower to load

fields.description:
From documentation on constraint filter:
Date: Only shows changesets that were created on or before that date. 


-------------
Actual behaviour: shows changesets that were created before that date.
fields.summary: Search results are filtered incorrectly by date constraint

fields.description:
When looking at an annotated file, it does syntax highlighting.  Great!! Except its wrong.  For example:

http://www.neuromancy.net/fisheye/browse/mantra/trunk/Mantra-I/mantra/utils/interruptable_mutex.h?r=419

Every 'do' in, say, do_lock, or 'int' in 'interruptable' is highlighted.

This is incorrect.
fields.summary: Syntax Highlighting is wrong (keywords match within identifiers - redux)

fields.description:
FishEye (or one of its libraries) is leaking file descriptors, that is, it is not closing either files or sockets, before discarding them.  They eventually do get closed when the garbage collector picks them up, however, on a server with per user file descriptor limits, this can get FishEye into a deadlock situation, where it won't use any more memory because every time it tries to do something, it fails because it can't obtain a file descriptor, and the garbage collector won't clean the file descriptors up because no memory is being used.  Even if the garbage collector does eventually run, FishEye doesn't fully recover, returning http 500 internal server errors.

The problem is documented in greater detail here:

https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/FishEye+Performance+Issues

We will be trying JavaHL native libraries to see if we can solve some other performance issues, if that solves the file descriptor issue, then that will determine that it's an SVNKit problem.
fields.summary: FishEye leaks file descriptors

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20080506-q471sue2gke8986stihade8sn6.jpg!
fields.summary: Charting Colors Broken

fields.description:
The "author" charts can be nice (e.g. to get a quick idea of who the go-to person far some part of a project may be).

Unfortunately, if a project has been moved or renamed, all LOC are attributed to the person who did the renaming operation!
fields.summary: Better handling of svn rename & author stats

fields.description: If a commit contains nothing but a property change (e.g. added a svn:ignore), FishEye isn't able to show a diff (the link is there but following it doesn't seem to have an effect).
fields.summary: Should show svn property changes in diff

fields.description:
CWD-870 is the trigger.

1- Create an issue. Include some {{monospaced}} text in the description.
2- Check in some code.
3- Click on the FishEye tab.
4- Click on "Create a crucible review".

Result: 502 proxy error, apparently caused by the presence of the \{\{ (or the \}\}) in the URL.
fields.summary: FishEye plugin in JIRA does not properly escape "{{" when attempting to create crucible review

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Go into profile
2) Click delete link next to watch
3) Watch is shown as deleted
4) Wait until the deleted watch would be triggered by a commit

Expected result: 
No email, watch remains deleted

Actual result:
Still receive watch email, if you go back into the profile the watch has reappeared

Notes:
This is on my account in FishEye and the watch is setup for the root level of a configured repository. I assume this was part of your standard release testing, so maybe our use of the lowercase usernames flag in the config is messing up the watch deletion (its trying to delete with the non-LC username or vice versa and thinks its successful when it isn't).
fields.summary: Watches are not being deleted

fields.description:
When a pre-1.5 repository is upgraded "Store Diff Info" is disabled so a full reslurp is not triggered. The implications of this need to be loudly communicated to admins and users, so that they can enable it and schedule a reindex. 

* Add the Author option back to the "Show by" constraint as disabled with an asterisk/footnote indicator
* Add an info box/footnote to the chart page that says something like: 

bq. Author statistics are disabled, enable "Store Diff Info" and reindex, [more|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Store+Diff+Info].

* Add a warning to the repository detail page in admin that says something like:

bq. This repository is not storing diff information. This means that per author charting is disabled. Edit the repository settings to enable. A full re-index is required for this setting to take effect. See the [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Store+Diff+Info] for more information.
fields.summary: Author info/Store diff info Warning when disabled

fields.description: Currently, Quick Search does not search through the content of files.
fields.summary: Do content searches in quicksearch

fields.description:
Particularly file-name search, but quick search in general.

Avoid a complete re-index if possible (re-build just lucene index if possible)
fields.summary: improve performance of filename searches in quicksearch
Improved Quick Search

show match-in-context in quicksearch (hit highlighting)
show match-in-context in normal search results (hit highlighting)

fields.description: I frequently navigate somewhere in FE and think "ok, now that I've found this thing, I want to check it out." I have to copy the URL from the browser and then tweak it manually. A good convenience feature to this would be a little permalink-style icon on each page that would allow me to copy the "real" version of the URL to this point in the repository so I could copy and paste it to my terminal.
fields.summary: Every File or Directory view in FE should have a shortcut link with the full SVN URL for copying

fields.description: Linker not parsing the checkin comments in a watch notification email correctly. see attached screenshot
fields.summary: Email watch notification does not properly parse the checkin comments for links (to jira/cru for example)

fields.description:
It would be awesome to have fisheye notify you when a new release is available.

* It should be opt-in (since it involves pinging an atlassian server)
* In the simplest for it could be  a check for updates item in the admin menu
* A better version would be a daily/weekly check that turns on a banner in admin or even an icon on every page
fields.summary: Check for updates option

fields.description:
We used to have both the Subversion plugin and Fisheye plugin for JIRA.  There was no sense maintaining both, so I removed the Subversion plugin.  I had a user point out that the Subversion plugin output made it easier to see which files had been modified, added and deleted.

Would it be possible to change the formatting of the change log to make the file status standout, similar to the way it does using color-coded words in the first column of the results displayed in the Subversion plugin?

Please see example in attachment with the side-by-side results from the Subversion plugin and the Fisheye plugin for JIRA.
fields.summary: Make file status (modify, add, delete) stand out in changelog of JIRA plugin

fields.description:
I would like to be able to force a directory as hidden that has already been indexed such that users cannot view them at all. The files should not be visible when searching either.

This is a solution to get around the fact that adding an exclude forces you to re-index, which in our case takes about 2-3 weeks to actually complete and therefore makes it worthless unless you know the specific location before someone checks it in (which is rare in my experience).
fields.summary: Allow admin to specify hidden directories that users cannot override to view

fields.description:
svn mv tags/build-02 branches/br-06

svn list branches shows that br-06 is present in svn, but it is not added to fisheye.  Slurping subsequent edits to files in the branch fail with the error:

2008-04-24 14:08:25,815 ERROR [pool-1-thread-1] fisheye.app com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.DiffChangeSetProcessor-processModification - Modification found to branches/br-06/test.txt@13 with no previous revision
2008-04-24 14:08:25,815 ERROR [pool-1-thread-1] fisheye.app com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.DiffChangeSetProcessor-insertNewRevision - Not inserting revision branches/br-06/test.txt@13 because a parent directory is missing

Dump file test/testfiles/svn/dumps/testTagBranch.dump includes this scenario.
fields.summary: if a tag is renamed as a branch fisheye deletes the tag but does not create the new branch

fields.summary: upgrade svnkit to 1.1.7

fields.description:
UserManager now has dual functions, user-management and login-management, and the latter is  now shared with UserDetector.

They should be more cleanly separated. eg who puts/gets things out of sessions etc.

Also consider FE-412/FE-413. The UserDetector.process() and getUser() methods are a bit of a mess. We should more cleanly implement our process like seraph's Crowd Authenticator:

try trusted apps
otherwise crowd.isAuthenticated()
otherwise rememberme
otherwise BASIC AUTH
otherwise logout/clearLoginTokens()
fields.summary: refactor login-management and user-management

fields.description:
There are some situations where the crowd.token issued by one Crowd-enabled app are not compatible with another app, even though they are talking to the same Crowd server (see CWD-541). For example, where one app is connected to Apache using AJP13 and the other is using HTTP ProxyPass. In these scenarios, Single Sign On will not work.

In these cases, if you login to FishEye/Crucible, then login to the other Crowd-enabled app, your crowd.token issued by FishEye is invalidated and will time out after 2 minutes.

The symptom you will see in 1.5 is, after not using Crucible/FishEye for a few minutes, your next request to Crucible/FishEye will succeed as authenticated, but the very next request will not.
fields.summary: [crowd] logged out after 2 minutes when using another "incompatible" crowd app with FishEye/Crucible

fields.description:
Add ability for FishEye to use Crowd to check username/passwords and group membership, without participating in Single Sign On (SSO). In this mode, FishEye will not read or set crowd.token cookies.

This is useful in environments where you want FishEye to ignore crowd.token cookies set by other applications (see FE-413)
fields.summary: Add ability to turn off SSO in FishEye/Crucible's crowd support

fields.description:
Between the stream plugin and the changes plugin in intellij (see screenshot) I really think that FishEye (and probably Crucible) could benefit from this style of grouping.  That is, when you are viewing recent activity they are grouped (and possibly collapsed) into logical date hunks like, today, last week, last month, etc. 

This would also fit into an effort to make FishEye's default views less verbose and more customizable. 

!http://img.skitch.com/20080421-nmqbib8sn26hi8een3pq3m151j.jpg!
fields.summary: Group changelog (and file history) with "smart dates"

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-406

e.g. http://skitch.com/ptemo/j7eg/fisheye-chart-private-tmpscan https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/chart/~charttype=Area,stacktype=Subdirectory/private_tmpscan/atlassian/perforce-jira-plugin/trunk

fields.description: We annotate all our CVS checkins with JIRA bug IDs.  It would be nice to be able to click on those and be taken to that bug in JIRA.
fields.summary: clickable JIRA links

fields.description: If you set your diff style to side-by-side in your profile, logout, and log back in, it is reset to unified.
fields.summary: Setting diff style to side-by-side in profile doesn't stick

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Run FE
# Open Server Settings
# Change values for Resource Limits
# Change them again
# You'll get something like this in your config.xml:
{noformat}
<resources><incrementalIndexThreads max="3"/><initialIndexThreads max="3"/><incrementalIndexThreads/><initialIndexThreads/></resources>
{noformat}
fields.summary: incrementalIndexThreads and initialIndexThreads are incorrectly stored in config.xml

fields.description:
Originated from http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257278759&tstart=0#257278759

Currently if you run scannow command, or use web interface and there is a situation that there are no threads available for immediate execution the request will be rescheduled. But unfortunately that can cause it will not be the next one to be executed - because some other repositories can trigger scan before it.

Ideal situation would be that after using scan now the selected repository gets higher priority and is places as the one next to be scanned and all other repositories will have to be scheduled after it.
fields.summary: Using scannow command or Scan Now button should trigger scanning ASAP

fields.description: As raised in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-666

Pawel

fields.description:
Under user profile, display settings tab, select no for 'Show empty directories' option. Save the preference. 

The empty directories are not displayed. But if the browser is closed, then reopened, the empty directory is displayed again. Going back into the profile, display settings tab again, the  'Show empty directories' option is on yes. 

addendum: this occurs whether using a built in user, or a crowd-ed user.
fields.summary: User display preference setting in profile not saved

fields.description:
I'm not sure if this is a bug, or just behaviour that isn't explained well or understood by me.

I attempted to browse to the following URL: https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/browse/private/atlassian/jira/trunk/project.xml?r1=57229&r2=52750
This is with the profile option 'File history view mode' set to *Physical*
Note the file revisions:
*52750* and *57229*

The revisions that actually show up in the diff are different:
*52520* and *57168*

When I change the profile option to *Logical*, the diff shows the correct versions when visiting the previous URL.

Can I ask why this is the case? It's slightly confusing.
fields.summary: Some file revisions only visible under 'Logical' mode?

fields.description: During debugging I added a lock to prevent concurrent LOC reslurps.  This should not be necessary if we control where this method is called from.
fields.summary: review multithreading of RevCacheReader

fields.description: Currently, we don't calculate and store the diffs for copies and moves.  The current assumption in the author blame calculation is that if there is no change in LOC the new file has the same author blame as the original file.  This is a weak assumption and doesn't help us when there is a change in the LOC, in which case we currently assign the total author blame to the person who made the copy/move.
fields.summary: Calculate/store diffs for copies and moves

fields.description: There's a lot of old pre-bucket charting code that can probably be removed at this point to clean up the codebase.
fields.summary: Old charting code can probably be removed now

fields.description: At present you need to go back to the Fisheye main page to change repos, a drop down menu of all repos, like the Crucible Projects drop-down would be nice
fields.summary: Put a drop-down menu allowing selection of repo next to the 'root repo link'

fields.description:
While examining an annotated Java(1) source code file, eg. from a search or changeset, we would like the ability to "click" on external methods, classes or packages and follow the link directly to its source (applicable to that version) which we can assume is also in the repository.  Similar to the same feature in http://java2html.com.


(1) Our team is only really interested in Java sources here, but this would probably be useful as a more generic facility (pluggable language support?) for others.

This may also apply to Crucible, since this came up when considering crucible.
fields.summary: Add browsable cross-links to annotated source code files. i.e. source XREF

fields.description: We are looking a a product to allow us to look at the impact (graphically if possible) of a change to one code module i.e. every where it's used. I would have thought that FishEye does this but after reding about and also watching the on-line presentation I'm not so sure. Please advise and point to relivant documentation. If you don't support this type of feature what do you use?
fields.summary: Which Atlassian products suport impact analysis features

fields.description:
It would be cool to render thumbnail versions of all three chart types for each big chart to enable switching between types (i.e. pie|line|area). e.g. something like:

!http://img.skitch.com/20080411-cpjh5abakbwha9dchbe5xkhtp5.jpg!
fields.summary: Sexy chart type switching

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20080411-rfsnx381pnmrn9yw8gju2m85kr.png!
fields.summary: Small Line History Chart Tweaks

fields.description: When you add a date constraint to zoom in on a chart, it should really redraw instead of just clip. See the attached movie for an example, note specifically the legend/buckets are meaningless after the zoom and the commit volume scale as well.
fields.summary: Date constraint should do more than clip

fields.description: see FSH-649
fields.summary: Improve determination of first revision in an SVN repo

fields.description: Create an admin interface to edit the username force-lowercase configuration. Preferably add the admin interface to the security admin screen.
fields.summary: Create an admin interface to edit the username force-lowercase configuration in security

fields.description:
Im currently running FishEye 1.4.3 build-273 and Crucible 1.2.3 build-273 on the built-in server. 
It would have been convenient if you had released a deployable ear/war, so it can be deployed on my app-server instance together with JIRA, Confluence and Bamboo. I assume that this will could be convenient for others than me.

Im aware of the "Integrating with Other Web Servers"-guide at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Integrating+with+Other+Web+Servers.
fields.summary: Release Fisheye as a deployable ear/war

fields.description: Add an option for RSS feeds that if selected will include diffs into RSS. Now RSS feed includes only links to FishEye - you can see diff after clicking. The idea is that the feed itself will include the diff.
fields.summary: Diff included into RSS feed

fields.description:
Originated from forum - http://forums.atlassian.com/post!reply.jspa?messageID=257276397
Idea is to have an ability to say that you want to get a diff for a given revision and the one before it when making a diff for a file - so you don't have to know which revision was before. Allows easier linking to the diff view.
fields.summary: Add a shortcut in browse for making a diff for a given revision and the one before it

fields.description: In our repository, I have commits as "brendan" and "bhumphreys".  the current author mapping makes me choose one of these - it would be nice to be able to have multiple mappings per repository so I could own commits under both names.
fields.summary: ability map mulitple authors per repository
admin screen for force-lowercase

fields.description:
Fisheye changeset email templates are monolithic in that both batch and immediate changeset notifications are using the same template, making the templates hard to edit, as well as very large with embedded logic - e.g., in the subject, the size of the changeset is used to determine whether to display the commit message or not. 

Should split them up into two templates, one for handling batch, one for handling immediate, and factor out the common parts into a #include file (like common-body).
fields.summary: split fisheye changeset email template to a daily/batch one and an immediate one

fields.description:
static content seems to have an expires header of epoc, due to the DefaultServlet AFAICT.

/static in general should have an expires header in the order of days
/static/RANDSTR should have a expires-never header
fields.summary: set a sensible expires header for static content

fields.description:
use org.mortbay.servlet.Gzfilter instead of our own gz filter

also see https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-628
fields.summary: static content is not being gz encoded

fields.description:
In a Subversion 1.3 repository, accessed via Apache + mod_webdav_svn.

I have a changeset (revision 19717) containing 3 file modifications: 1 properties file (X.properties) one .java file (X.java) and one .htm file (X.htm) (names changed to protect the guilty).

With the properties file and .htm file the diff viewer seems to be working correctly (as it seems to be with other files).
With the .java file though (and only this one file that I can see), selecting any source or target revision that doesn't have a changelog entry for the file results in a 100% diff (either add or delete).

e.g. for X.java there are changelog entries at revisions 19717, 19707 and 17909, while the diff viewer also lists 19623 (and some other revisions).
Digging any pair of revisions with changelog entries yields a correct diff, but comparing 19717 to 19623 gives a 100% add diff.

What I'd expect to see is each revision being treated by the diff viewer as Subversion treats them - e.g. revision 19708 of X.java is identical to revision 19707, even though X.java was not modified in revision 19708.
(What I'd really expect to see is only those revisions with changelogs in the diff viewer options)

I'm not sure what other information I can gather, so let me know if there is further information that can be gathered.
fields.summary: Diff for a file including a revision not in the changelog yields a 100% diff
Improving the chart page in fisheye

fields.description: It would be nice if one could see easily the Lines of code inside a SVN repository, which results in automatically counting all the trunk/ subdirectories. At the moment all branches and tags are calculated which gives no real useful informations. Diving down into all the subdirectories and calculating the lines of code manually in every trunk/ directory somehow also is no solution.
fields.summary: Option for lines of code in all /trunk subdirectories

fields.description: If I create a new tag in copying over e.g. from the trunk or a branch, Fisheye doesn't state where the new tag originates from. It just mentions that these files are new/copied.
fields.summary: For copied branches (e.g for tagging purposes) the source should appear.

fields.description: Usage scenario: you enable this for repository or all repositories. Then when you go to a specific changeset (or list of changesets) you have an option to download all files modified in it. There's an option to get a patch for a given changeset. This should be an additional feature.
fields.summary: Support for downloading files modified by given changeset.

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to set the changelist number from which the initial scan would begin.

We have a very large and old repository and I want to ignore the first 400k changelists, but can't find a way to do it.

I believe this funcionality exists for svn.

Thank you
fields.summary: Please add ability to specify initial revision from which to begin initial scan

fields.description: Add git (http://git.or.cz/) version control system support into FishEye.
fields.summary: Add support for GIT scm

fields.description:
Just take a look at screenshot.
Nice! :)
fields.summary: Random order of operations on Trusted Applications

fields.description: When I am trying to add a new Trusted App, FishEye proposes 0 as default value for Certificate Timeout. It's apparently a bug and inconsistency with documentation which says default value is 1000.
fields.summary: Default Certificate Timeout value for Trusted Applications should not be 0
Improve the documentation shown in the "Repository Config" session of FishEye's API

fields.description:
Appears to be slightly different from FE-182.

fields.description:
Situation
------------
Currently the fisheye server process may use 1,5G of memory, which is enough during all normal operations.
However, there are out of memory exceptions when the fisheye plugin in Jira is used to show bigger check-ins,
e.g. many change-sets over a longer period of time.

The fisheye server is still accessing and indexing all repositories, but the thread for searching and displaying things
stops to work.
This may be a configuration issue with the application server or something more complicated, but it is surely annoying,
because normal users can effectively crash the fisheye server by a simple click on a jira issue.


1. Exception
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

fields.summary: Out of Memory errors when jira plugin accesses the remote api

fields.description:
We're using Crowd against our LDAP directory. Users in the LDAP directory have upper-case credentials.

When logging into Fisheye (through Crowd), users must supply their credentials with upper-case. It doesn't work when they try with lower-case.

Other applications (Confluence, Jira) seems to ignore the case.

It is not uncommon to see the same user credentials twice in the Crowd admin console (one with upper-case and one with lower-case).

I suggest that the case sensitivity is simply removed from Fisheye, so it works like Confluence and Jira.
fields.summary: User credentials are case-sensitive

fields.description:
The one and only piece of information I want in the subject: line of the RSS feeds from fisheye is the filename of the file that's been modified.  Instead, the subject: line includes seemingly every other piece of information besides this one crucial one, which creates a really long (and useless) subject: line.

Please make the subject: line customizable or at least include the filename somewhere in the subject: line so I can programmatically extract it out (via regex) of the RSS XML and thereby create my own RSS feed with this one crucial piece of information.

Otherwise, the RSS feeds are the worst kind of feature: a feature that tempts you and looks great in a marketing checklist, but does exactly the wrong thing when you actually try to use it in the real world.
fields.summary: Customisable RSS feeds

fields.description: when viewing the history of a file, I often want to quickly inspect the diffs over time. Something that would streamline this is links on the diff page that link to the prev/next diff for the file.
fields.summary: diff screen needs quick navigation links to prev/next diff

fields.description:
>> How do I get an eyeql query to list the most recent changes first? (I can't imagine why the default is to
>> show the oldest changes first.) The query below (and others like it) lists the oldest changes first,
>> and the SQL DESC modifier is rejected by eyeql.

>> select revisions from dir / where (not (author = "flash sheridan") and comment matches "Coverity") group by changeset

> Amir Hamzah [Atlassian] - 27/Mar/08 11:37 PM
> Unfortunately, there is a limitation in EyeQL. FishEye do provide the sorting for the search results.
> You can use "order by date" clause but it is always "order by date ascending" which will return the same
> (oldest changes first). We don't have "order by date desc" at the moment.
fields.summary: FishEye always sorts with oldest first
Add syntax highlighting for ActionScript (.as) files

fields.description:
I have no idea if this was request before, but we are really have interest in recognizing Perforce workspaces as a good feature  for next release,.

These will be the repositories that someone will have to triage and assign code reviews for.  Since a changelist will likely only appear in one of these branches, we won't have duplication.  (Although it is possible for a changelist to modify files in multiple places, it isn't a common practice).

The problems are for code reviews and crucible:
-          Making sure all the code changes are seen.
-          Making sure the changelists are reviewed only once.

Thanks,.
Moises,
fields.summary: support client spec for fisheye and crucible
